properties.areaDesc: Martin, KY; Mingo, WV; Pike, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 6:50AM EST until February 7 at 8:39PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Kentucky...West Virginia...

Tug Fork River At Williamson affecting Pike, Mingo and Martin
Counties.

For the Tug Fork River...Moderate flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Tug Fork River At Williamson.
* Until this evening.
* At 6:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 33.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 27.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending
at 6:00 AM EST Friday was 33.9 feet.
* Forecast...The river has crested this morning 34.18. It will then
fall below flood stage this afternoon.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.0
feet on 12/12/1926.
properties.instruction:
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths
occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges,
dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream,
even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route
over higher ground.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning remains in effect
